episodes.title: Alamo Christian Foundation | Tony Alamo Part 2
episodes.description: During the week after the federal raid and Tony Alamo's arrest in Sept 2008, former members came forward with their stories. Some described difficulty making their own decisions in everyday life; some described a lasting fear of dogs, who Tony Alamo called "evil beings who would weaken children's hearts." Others came forward with stories of spiritual, sexual, and physical abuse. This week, we dive into the human toll of the Alamo Christian Foundation.Disclaimer: Anything in this podcast is based on our research and our own opinions. Content is not acceptable for children. episodes.title: Children of Thunder | Glenn Taylor Helzer
episodes.description: Glenn Taylor Helzer was a self-declared prophet, former cult leader, and serial killer who founded and led the Children of Thunder. Helzer and his followers murdered five people as part of an extortion plot intended to culminate with Helzer taking over The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints (LDS Church aka Mormons) and hastening the return of Christ.Disclaimer: Anything in this podcast is based on our research and our own opinions. Content is not acceptable for children. episodes.title: Word of Faith Fellowship
episodes.description: Not all cults are gone. This week, Jada tells us about a cult that is alive and well in the backwoods of North Carolina.  The Word of Faith Fellowship is a group founded by Sam and Jane Whaley. With allegations of sexual assault and physical abuse, this cult is not fun at all.Disclaimer: Anything in this podcast is based on our research and our own opinions. episodes.title: Biblicist Christianity and the Manosphere
episodes.description: A search into Biblicist Christianity started when Jada sent me a link to an article titled, “A Christian Husband’s Guide to Grooming His Young Wife”. What started as a quick Facebook message turned into a four-hour rabbit hole combing through a website that made me want to gouge my eyes out. So that’s what we are talking about today on the podcast.Disclaimer: Anything in this podcast is based on our research and our own opinions. Content is not acceptable for children. episodes.title: Church of the Last Testament | Sergey Anatolyevitch Torop
episodes.description: An ex-traffic patrol officer with a cult following known as The Church of The Last Testament was arrested in his settlement in Siberia at dawn on Sept 21, 2020. His followers call him Vissarion, meaning "he who gives new life", and many (but not all) of them believe him when he claims to be Jesus Christ reborn.Disclaimer: Anything in this podcast is based on our research and our own opinions. Content is not acceptable for children. episodes.title: The Branch Davidians Part 3
episodes.description: Twenty-seven years ago, on February 28, 1993, the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, and Firearms agents attempted to execute a “dynamic entry” into the compound of The Branch Davidians at Mount Carmel. The failed operation then turned into a 51-day standoff. During that time, Koresh and most of his followers had refused to leave the compound, which was surrounded by tanks, armored vehicles, and more than 600 federal agents. The standoff ended when a fire engulfed the complex on April 19, 1993. Only nine people inside survived. This week, we are talking about the Waco Siege that turned into a massacre.Disclaimer: Anything in this podcast is based on our research and our own opinions. Content is not acceptable for children. Listener discretion is advised.To view all sources and notes, visit www.twosisterscult.com/episodesFor a full list of show sponsors, visit www.twosisterscult.com/savingsSupport the show

episodes.title: The Branch Davidians Part 2
episodes.description: In the last episode, we left members of the Branch Davidians with their President, George Roden. This situation caused some serious issues with the members and led to the rise of David Koresh. This week, we are covering the life of David Koresh and the Branch Davidians leading up to the siege of Mount Carmel in February 1993.Disclaimer: Anything in this podcast is based on our research and our own opinions. Content is not acceptable for children. Listener discretion is advised.To view all sources and notes, visit www.twosisterscult.com/episodesFor a full list of show sponsors, visit www.twosisterscult.com/savingsSupport the show

episodes.title: The Branch Davidians Part 1
episodes.description: Most people can tell you what happened on April 19, 1993, in Waco, Texas when law enforcement laid siege to the Branch Davidian compound. Eventually, the FBI launched an assault and initiated a tear gas attack in an attempt to force the Branch Davidians out of the ranch. Shortly thereafter, the Mount Carmel Center quickly became engulfed in flames. The fire resulted in the deaths of 76 Branch Davidians, including 25 children, two pregnant women, and the current leader, David Koresh. But how were the Branch Davidians formed? That’s the topic for today’s episode.Disclaimer: Anything in this podcast is based on our research and our own opinions. Content is not acceptable for children. Listener discretion is advised.To view all sources and notes, visit www.twosisterscult.com/episodesFor a full list of show sponsors, visit www.twosisterscult.com/savingsSupport the show

episodes.title: Universe People | Cosmic People
episodes.description: Ivo Benda, the founder of the UFO cult known as the Universe People, the Cosmic People, and the Cosmic People of Light, wrote a 28-part essay to The Czech and Slovak presidents, detailing why they should accept his invitation to meet with the Pleiadian aliens he was friends with. They did not accept it.Disclaimer: Anything in this podcast is based on our research and our own opinions. Content is not acceptable for children. Listener discretion is advised.To view all sources and notes, visit www.twosisterscult.com/episodesFor a full list of show sponsors, visit www.twosisterscult.com/savingsSupport the show

episodes.title: The Oneida Community and John Humphrey Noyes
episodes.description: What do dinnerware and silverware have to do with cults? Well,  we will find out during this episode as we talk about John Humphrey Noyes, the leader of a late 19th-century cult community known as The Oneida Community. With a mix of free love, perfectionism, eugenics, and utopian society, this community turned into a dinnerware company that is still thriving today.Disclaimer: Anything in this podcast is based on our research and our own opinions. Content is not acceptable for children. Listener discretion is advised.To view all sources and notes, visit www.twosisterscult.com/episodesFor a full list of show sponsors, visit www.twosisterscult.com/savingsBuzzsprout - Let's get your podcast launched! episodes.title: Fall River Cult Murders
episodes.description: This week Alesia tells Jada about a series of murders that took place between October 1979 and February 1980. The Fall River Cult Murders became the most sensational criminal case to come out of Fall River since Lizzie Borden stood trial for butchering her parents nearly a century earlier.Disclaimer: Anything in this podcast is based on our research and our own opinions. episodes.title: Mithraism
episodes.description: This week, Jada's taking us back to pre-Christian Rome, to talk about the ancient cult of “Mithraism”, the Mithraic Mysteries. The Mithraic Mysteries and the cult that kept them has been mostly forgotten by the modern world. Mithra, or Mithras, was an Indo-Iranian sun god, also associated with kings, warriors, war, justice, and contracts.Disclaimer: Anything in this podcast is based on our research and our own opinions. Content is not acceptable for children. Listener discretion is advised.To view all sources and notes, visit www.twosisterscult.com/episodesFor a full list of show sponsors, visit www.twosisterscult.com/savingsSupport the show

episodes.title: Father Divine
episodes.description: Peace Mission, a predominantly black 20th-century religious movement in the United States, founded and led by Father Divine, who was regarded or worshiped, by his followers as God, Dean of the Universe, and Harnesser of Atomic Energy. He was immersed in primitive mysticism and the Holiness and Pentecostal movements. Father Divine was equal parts holy man, charlatan, civil rights leader, and wildly successful restaurateur.Join Alesia and Jada this week as Alesia talks through the man who influenced Jim Jones and didn't believe in race.Disclaimer: Anything in this podcast is based on our research and our own opinions. Content is not acceptable for children. Listener discretion is advised.To view all sources and notes, visit www.twosisterscult.com/episodesFor a full list of show sponsors, visit www.twosisterscult.com/savingsSupport the show

episodes.description: Over 40 years ago, Jim Jones promised his followers a modern-day Garden of Eden when they followed him to the jungles of Guyana in South America. Instead, they found confinement, mental and physical control, and forced suicide. This is the final installment of our Jonestown series. This is not going to be easy.Disclaimer: Anything in this podcast is based on our research and our own opinions. Content is not acceptable for children. episodes.title: Aggressive Christianity
episodes.description: For several decades, New Mexico police had suspected something not quite right with a local Christian group, but could not find the evidence they needed. But in 2017, Bill Miller’s search for his 12-year-old son Enoch led the police on to the compound, resulting in at least eight arrests, several accusations of child abuse, and one 72-year sentence for the leader of this cult. This week, Jada tells us about the story of James and Deborah Green and their cult Aggressive Christianity Missions Training Corps.Disclaimer: Anything in this podcast is based on our research and our own opinions. Content is not acceptable for children. Listener discretion is advised.To view all sources and notes, visit www.twosisterscult.com/episodesFor a full list of show sponsors, visit www.twosisterscult.com/savingsSupport the show

episodes.title: William "Little Pebble" Kamm
episodes.description: Australia is mostly known for its slew of dangerous animals. But what about their cults? Today, Alesia talks about The Order of St. Charbel, an Australian cult started by William "Little Pebble" Kamm. He believed that he had received visions from the Virgin Mary saying that she was going to provide 12 queens and 72 princesses for him to repopulate the postapocalyptic Earth with his “holy seed".Disclaimer: Content is not acceptable for children.
